page.title: 03Local History
page.content:
Much of the land is owned by the {Penrhyn estate,}one of the biggest landowners in the area. In the last century and for much of this they also owned the big{Penrhyn Quarries}at Bethesda and before{Port Penrhyn}was built, with its tramway connection to the Quarry, the slate was brought to the mouth of the{River Ogwen,}near to the present Spinneys nature reserve, for shipping to its markets. Now few signs, if any, remain of this traffic.
At the promontory at reference{605731 there is an old bath house at the waters edge. This was also part of the facilities ofered at the castle although no longer in use!
